subject: Re: Hi guys when you load the site northshoreent.com.au on a mobile dev...
preview: Help David understand how they're doing:          Rate your conversation               On Wed, Mar 27, 2019 at 04:03 AM, "David Greene"  wrote:   Hello! I know its early there. We haven't heard back f

full_threads.body:
Help David understand how they're doing:
Rate your conversation
On Wed, Mar 27, 2019 at 04:03 AM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hello! I know its early there.

We haven't heard back from you on this topic in a while so we're going to go ahead and close this conversation.

However, if you do need further assistance you can simply reply and the conversation will be reopened or you can start a new conversation.

Let us know if you need further assistance!

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 09:45 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Thanks for waiting!

We've completed the repair of the infected site, and reinstalled a clean copy of the WP core files (5.1.1 same as before).

I would recommend removing and reinstalling these two plugins in addition to Gravityforms, js_composer, and qube-importer (or removing this one)
blogvault-real-time-backup - Checksum does not match
sendgrid-email-delivery-simplified - Checksum does not match

wp-config.php
define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true);
This has been set to true now.

define( 'AUTH_SALT', 'G&@O@K~g1.NLnlrG;}5Y2,0-a3mH!;{#P2l8)XhWdLY^p*3J<5d%G?d[i~{(Mupi' );

An AUTH_SALT was already added in the salts block for Wordpress, which seems suspicious. This was commented out and changed to invalidate any logins using it.

Files:
Moved to ~/suspected. Each contains code allowing a backdoor/webshell, or can cause a redirect.
index2.php index.php validate.php wp-interst.php

Manually cleaned:
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/tooltips.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/includes/fields/class-gf-field-email.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/includes/fields/class-gf-field-calculation.php
www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/includes/fields/class-gf-field-repeater.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/includes/fields/class-gf-field-select.php

/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/qube-importer/demo-files/Ezio-Freelancer/index.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/sendgrid-email-delivery-simplified/lib/sendgrid/class-sendgrid-php.php

/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/js_composer/include/templates/shortcodes/vc_gitem_image.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/js_composer/include/templates/shortcodes/vc_button2.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/js_composer/include/templates/shortcodes/vc_gitem_zone.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/js_composer/include/classes/core/shared-templates/importer/wordpress-importer.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/js_composer/include/classes/shortcodes/vc-masonry-media-grid.php
/www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/js_composer/include/classes/editors/navbar/class-vc-navbar-frontend.php
www/northshoreent_886/public/wp-content/plugins/js_composer/config/wp/shortcode-vc-wp-archives.php


Directories: These were moved to ~/private (files inside do contain malicious code, so I recommend deleting them)
wp-admin-old
wp-includes-old
plugins/old-plugins

Below you will see a list of all WordPress users with administrator access to the site. Please review this list carefully and then log into your site and delete any administrators that are no longer needed or that you do not recognize:

heath
joel
professionalit
support

As a preventative measure we have updated the WordPress salts in the wp-config.php file. This will have the effect of causing all users to be logged out of the site. So all users will have to log in the next time they access the site.

In addition, please note that the SFTP/SSH and database passwords have been changed. The next time you use SFTP/SSH or access phpMyAdmin you will need to use the updated passwords.

We would ask that you take the following steps within the next 24 hours:

  1. Install any available updates to the WordPress core and the site's themes and plugins.
  2. Require all administrators to change their WordPress passwords.
  3. Require all MyKinsta users to change their passwords.

Known vulnerabilities in older versions of plugins, themes, and the WordPress core are a common point of entry for malicious activity.
As a result, it is our policy that any site that has been infected with malware must have the WordPress core, as well as all plugins and themes updated to the latest version within 24 hours of repair. If this is not done the site will no longer be eligible for future free malware removal.

Please notify us as soon as updates have been applied so that we can update our records to reflect that all updates have been applied.

Finally, please note that we have disabled the theme and plugin editors in the WordPress admin area. While we recommend leaving these disabled permanently, if you do use them you can reenable them after all users have updated their passwords by removing these lines from your site's wp-config.php file:

define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true);

Let us know if you have any questions!

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:36 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

You're welcome!

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:36 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Awesome thanks David!!

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:35 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

OK, no problem. That will be just fine.
I'll work on this and send an update to you.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:35 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

No probs, I'm very appreciative. I'm based in Sydney, so it's well past clock off time for me. I/ll be on emails on the bus though, so feel free to message if you need anything. Is that ok with you?

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:34 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I may still need to remove things for a bit, but I'll try to make it quick/seamless if possible.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:34 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

ok sure

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:33 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Na, let me clean things first if you don't mind. Then you can scan it again from that side and see if it finds anything.
With the files I've found so far... running that cleanup will pretty much wipe out the installation. If it does any sort of deletion.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:32 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ah that would be amazing.

Did you want me to trigger the clean my site function on Malcare?

I've never used it before...

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:31 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Ah ok so it did find something.
There is a webshell in ~/public/validate.php and wp-interst.php looks pretty suspect as well.

Do you want us to try cleaning the installation?
https://kinsta.com/knowledgebase/security-guarantee/

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:30 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:
On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:30 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Ok, when you finish scanning let me know and I can try to clear this up if you want.
I know of at least one file in ~/public that should almost 100% be an issue, and lots of others have base64 code in them as well.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:28 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

I'm running a scan now using malcare by blogvault

yes those users are fine

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:28 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I don't see any new admin users, these should all be here right?
heath, joel, professionalit, support

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:28 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yeah we used managewp and it didn't pick anything up.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:27 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

We have an in house scanner for helping detect files, but cleanup and review is a manual process that can take some time.
Tools aren't all that reliable with unknown malware, so they can miss things.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:26 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yeah we noticed some random text appearing on the desktop version during the week and found some contaminated files apparently. We cleared the ones we found out about, but clearly there were some others hiding in there.

Are you using a malware tool or similar?

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:25 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

You're welcome.
Did this just start happening today that you know of?

There are a few suspicious files I'm looking at, so we'll need to do a few things.
Password changes and all that once we can remove the files with issues and clean everything up.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:17 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ok sure thanks

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:16 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Googlebot sees the mobile site fine too interestingly enough. Usually a Google useragent is the first thing I'd expect to be targeted.
https://search.google.com/test/mobile-friendly?id=96vAMOm2apfJaE_irJOtEQ

I'm scanning the site to see what may be there even though its not showing now.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:16 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yeah it's happening in other phones, my client called to alert us to it... apparently a few of them saw it on their phones

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:15 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

OK, that's somewhat good. It doesn't explain what causes/caused the problem, but it may just be a cached redirect in your browser.
Are other phones seeing the same problem?

I'm looking at some requests in the log like this one, to see what they are:
www.northshoreent.com.au 46.229.168.148 [22/Mar/2019:09:13:37 +0000] GET "/jp/fanky9928/480150204_565028850/ofx32675" HTTP/1.0 403

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:13 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Interestingly, when I load in incognito mode, it's normal!

on my phone that is

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:11 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

OK that may be helpful. I only have an Android phone but it looks good there.
Can you try loading it in private/incognito mode? I'm looking at the access log to see if anything may be helpful there.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:08 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

It's on Safari - iPhone, I'll send a screenshot now

Looks like Japanese? I'm not fluent though lol

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:08 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

What are you seeing on the mobile site that shouldn't be there?
I checked on my phone and see the mobile site loading. It could be browser or even device specific too though.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:05 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi David!

Cheers

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:05 PM, "David Greene" <david.greene@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hello

Let me check and see what I can find

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:05 PM, "Operator" <operator@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Kinsta typically replies in a few minutes.

On Fri, Mar 22, 2019 at 08:02 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi guys when you load the site northshoreent.com.au on a mobile device it looks like it has been hacked.

On desktop it seems to be normal - any ideas?
